result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Noe De Jesus Arias Polo
Current: 10619 North County Line Rd, Whitewater, WI 53190 United States  (Effective: 08-22-2022)
Prior: W7889 Reliance Rd, Whitewater, WI 53190
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22CM453 & 22CT338

Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Called at 2:00 PM. Defendant Noe De Jesus Arias Polo in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney James Dickenson for defendant. Interpreter Sarah St. John previously sworn. Record by Attorney Dickenson as to charges and penalties. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Court enters not guilty pleas on TR and FO cases. Status set 90 days out. Bond set at $10000 RoR. Spanish interpreter needed. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
